name: places/ChIJD4JramFYwokRfP8itcCgmbw
formattedAddress: 80 Riverside Blvd, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 80 Riverside Blvd, New York, NY 10023, USA

originalText.text:
I've been parking at this facility for over ten years, first when it was managed by Icon, and now by City Parking.  The staff here are pretty good.  They're generally understaffed, though, so if you hit them at a busy time, you'll end up waiting a few minutes.  It's never been more then ten minutes, though, and generally less than five.  No big complaints here.

The back office at City Parking is a different story, though.  It's impossible to get through to their billing department if you have a problem with a bill.  They never pick up the phone, never return calls, the chat window on their website is always unattended, and an email response can take days to weeks.  I recently emailed City Parking my new resident parking tax exemption certificate.  I sent it to their general email address and never got a response.  After (literally) weeks of calling, I finally got someone on the phone who told me I needed to send it to a different address. In a well-run organization, they would have forwarded it to the right person, or at least responded and told me who to send it to.  At City Parking, it just got ignored.

originalText.text: They open my trunk and they stole my impact driver. I opened file claim they never answered and they never call me. I requested same day video and they didn't show me so something wrong over there.Don't park your cars over there again be careful.

text.text: They open my trunk and they stole my impact driver. I opened file claim they never answered and they never call me. I requested same day video and they didn't show me so something wrong over there.Don't park your cars over there again be careful.

originalText.text: This is where I park my car. It’s close to home and it’s convenient. I like the staff. They are friendly and I have gotten to know them. However, my car has been bumped twice here. I know this is NYC and parking is tight, but I refuse to accept it as the norm. I will say, however, that they repaired the damage. They also RAISED my monthly rate.

originalText.text: I packed my car on 10/24/22 from 8:40am-5:45pm and there were things missing from my car. The valet people had my key.
